â€œWhat?â€ Everyoneâ€™s curiosity was piqued, and their gazes turned to the dean.

â€œEven now, I find it incredible. The bulldozer, which was working perfectly fine, suddenly broke down and wouldnâ€™t move. Three or four repairmen came, and they checked it all afternoon, but they couldnâ€™t figure out why the bulldozer had suddenly broken down,â€ the dean recalled.

â€œBroke down?â€ Old Xu and the others showed a hint of surprise on their faces.

At first, no one thought much of it. Seeing that the bulldozer was working, they drove it back in. As soon as they drove it in, the bulldozer broke down again,â€ the dean said, finding the whole incident incredibly strange every time he recalled it.

â€œSo, did you tow the vehicle away again?â€

â€œAfter going back and forth three or four times, I remember someone saying that this house could not be torn down, and that something bad would happen if it was. From then on, we locked this place up and stopped paying attention to it.â€

â€œThis house is so strange, Old Xu. I donâ€™t think we should go in rashly. Letâ€™s contact that child Qianxing and see what he says.â€ After hearing the deanâ€™s words, Zhao Zhen felt they should consult Lu Qianxing.

Old Xu agreed with Zhao Zhenâ€™s suggestion. â€œMm.â€

Then, Old Xu called Lu Qianxing and explained the current situation in detail. After listening to Old Xuâ€™s account, Lu Qianxing instructed Old Xu not to enter the lime building rashly.

â€œHow is it? What did Qianxing say?â€ Zhao Zhen asked anxiously as soon as Old Xu hung up the phone.

â€œQianxing said that he and Chen Hui are on their way, and asked us not to enter the lime building rashly,â€ Old Xu said, then turned to Old Chang. â€œOld Chang, you should go back first. Iâ€™ll handle the rest of the investigation myself.â€ Old Xu didnâ€™t want Old Chang to be too involved in the case.

â€œIâ€™m fine.â€

â€œOld Chang, listen to Old Xu and go back. If thereâ€™s anything, weâ€™ll contact you anytime,â€ Zhao Zhen also said, persuading Old Chang to leave.

â€œAt a time like this, how can I leave?â€ Although Old Chang knew that Old Xu and Zhao Zhen were looking out for him, he felt that since he had already come, there was no reason to retreat even if it was dangerous.

Seeing this, Old Xu walked forward, gently patted Old Changâ€™s shoulder, and then said slowly, â€œOld Chang, listen to my advice. Iâ€™ll handle this case. You have other things to do, so go back.â€

â€œOld Xuâ€¦â€

â€œOld Chang!â€ Old Xu said sternly, interrupting Old Chang, who was about to speak. â€œDo you remember what I asked you to do earlier?â€

â€œI remember,â€ Old Chang nodded.

â€œSince you remember, then go back and do what you need to do. Iâ€™ll handle this case,â€ Old Xu said calmly, then patted Old Changâ€™s shoulder again.

â€œOld Xuâ€¦â€ Old Chang looked at Old Xu, wanting to say something, but in the end, he chose to remain silent, nodded, and left with the dean without another word.

About an hour later, Lu Qianxing and Chen Hui rushed over, sweat still visible on their foreheads.

â€œIs this the morgue?â€ Lu Qianxing asked, panting heavily, as he looked at the lime building ahead.

â€œDonâ€™t rush, take a moment to catch your breath,â€ Old Xu said caringly, seeing them out of breath.

â€œItâ€™s fine.â€ Lu Qianxing waved his hand, took a deep breath, and then recovered. â€œYou havenâ€™t gone inside, have you?â€ he asked, looking at the three of them after he had caught his breath.

Old Xu and the other two shook their heads. Then, Old Xu handed the key given by the dean to Lu Qianxing. â€œHereâ€™s the key. We havenâ€™t gone in yet.â€

â€œGood, thatâ€™s good,â€ Lu Qianxing said, taking the key. His gaze then scanned the area around the lime building carefully.

After about five minutes, Lu Qianxing asked everyone to move the piled-up sundries away from the lime buildingâ€™s door.

Once the sundries were moved, they saw a rusty lock. Lu Qianxing took out the key, inserted it into the lock, and with a gentle turn, opened it.

â€œIt seems the lock isnâ€™t completely rusted,â€ Lu Qianxing said as he slowly pushed the iron door.

â€œCreak!â€ A piercing sound echoed as Lu Qianxing slowly pushed the iron door open. As soon as Lu Qianxing opened a crack in the door, a pungent, foul odor assailed their nostrils.

â€œWhy does it smell so bad? Is there a decaying corpse inside?â€ Chen Hui asked, pinching his nose.

â€œThis smell doesnâ€™t seem like the stench of a corpse,â€ Old Xu also said, pinching his nose.

As he smelled the foul odor, Lu Qianxing also pinched his nose with one hand while continuing to push the iron door with the other.

â€œCreak!â€ The piercing sound echoed again. When the iron door was more than halfway open, everyone could see several white-sheet-covered beds placed inside the morgue.

â€œDidnâ€™t they say it was converted into a warehouse? Why does it still look like a morgue inside?â€ Ning Hua asked, confused. According to what the dean had said earlier, the morgue had been converted into a warehouse, but judging by the current appearance, it didnâ€™t seem to be the case, as everything in the morgue remained unchanged.

Lu Qianxing pushed the iron door open completely but did not enter. Instead, his gaze meticulously swept across the morgue.

â€œThereâ€™s a lingering resentment here,â€ Lu Qianxing said, frowning after scanning the morgue.

â€œResentment? Could it beâ€¦ a ghost?â€ Chen Hui didnâ€™t say the word â€œghostâ€ but his expression made it clear to everyone what he was implying.

Lu Qianxing shook his head. â€œThereâ€™s only a lingering resentment. I havenâ€™t detected anything else.â€ As Lu Qianxing spoke, he took a piece of paper from his pocket and stood at the entrance of the morgue, muttering to himself. In the next instant, the paper caught fire, emitting thick black smoke. However, not long after the paper was lit, a gust of cold wind suddenly blew, extinguishing the flame.

â€œWhy did it go out again!â€ Seeing the paper extinguish as soon as it was lit, Chen Hui felt a chilling sensation crawl up his spine.

â€œWhat does it mean that it went out?â€ Old Xu and the other two looked at Chen Hui in confusion.

â€œThereâ€™s a ghost,â€ Chen Huiâ€™s reply caused Old Xu and the other two to shiver, and cold sweat broke out on their foreheads.

(End of Chapter)

title: Chapter 112 Little Girl
content:
Chapter 112: The Little Girl

"There's a ghost!"

Chen Hui's answer made the faces of Old Xu and the other two sink to the extreme. At the same time, everyone felt a cold, eerie wind blowing from behind them.

"Don't be nervous, the talisman I just lit isn't a ghost-detecting talisman." Seeing everyone's panicked expressions, Lu Qianxing gave an awkward smile.

"No ghost!" Everyone's eyes widened as they stared at Lu Qianxing.

"There's only residual resentment here, no 'ghost' exists." Being stared at by everyone, Lu Qianxing felt uncomfortable all over. He scratched his head and spoke awkwardly.

After Lu Qianxing's confirmation, Old Xu and the other two's gazes instantly shifted, and they all glared at Chen Hui ferociously.

"No, well, I I don't know if it wasn't." Chen Hui said with a wry smile.

"Alas, you kid, don't be so jumpy. The ghosts didn't scare me to death, but you scared me half to death." Old Xu gave Chen Hui a sideways glance, then heaved a sigh of relief.

"Yeah, Chen Hui, scaring people scares people to death!" Being startled by Chen Hui like this, Ning Hua also felt a chill run down his spine.

After confirming there were no ghosts, everyone also heaved a sigh of relief, and the fear on their faces dissipated.

"Qianxing, what was the talisman you just lit for?" After calming down, Old Xu asked Lu Qianxing.

"It's a resentment-dissipating talisman, a type of talisman used to resolve resentment. When the talisman burns out, the resentment can be successfully resolved. The talisman just now only burned halfway, which means the resentment in this place has not been resolved," Lu Qianxing explained to Old Xu in detail.

"Then what will happen if the resentment here is not resolved?" Ning Hua asked.

"You said before that this place would bring bad luck, and the reason for bringing bad luck is that the resentment here is too heavy. When resentment attaches itself to a person, it brings bad luck to the person who is attached to the resentment."

"I see." Ning Hua nodded, then spoke again, asking another question, "Then where does the resentment here come from?"

"Could it be because this is a morgue? Because the yin energy is too heavy, it became resentment?" Chen Hui guessed.

Lu Qianxing shook his head in response, "Generally speaking, too much yin energy can indeed transform into resentment, but this morgue has been abandoned for five years. Even the strongest resentment cannot last for such a long time. Moreover, if it were just ordinary resentment, the resentment-dissipating talisman could solve it." Lu Qianxing directly denied Chen Hui's idea.

"If that's the case, then where does this resentment come from? From Li Chao and his son?" Old Xu murmured, guessing in his heart.

"They just died in a car accident, will that accumulate so much resentment?" Zhao Zhen rested his chin on his hand, also guessing.

"If the resentment doesn't come from Li Chao and his son, then..." Ning Hua said, recalling the dean's words.

Just as Old Xu and the other two were deep in thought, suddenly, the gazes of Old Xu and the other two converged on Lu Qianxing in an instant.

Seeing the way Old Xu and the other two looked, Lu Qianxing was instantly stunned. Being stared at by the three of them made him feel uncomfortable all over. "Uh? What's wrong?"

"Qianxing, back in Black Water Village, the little girl lying in the bronze coffin was wearing a black dress." Old Xu was the first to speak.

"If our guess is correct, could the resentment here have some connection with the little girl in the bronze coffin?" Old Zhao added.

"Perhaps Li Chao and his son's deaths are related to that little girl," Ning Hua was the last to speak his guess.

Hearing what Old Xu and the other two said, Lu Qianxing also frowned.

"Qianxing, can you find out where the resentment comes from?"

"With my cultivation, I don't know if I can, but I can try." Although there was a method, because Lu Qianxing's cultivation was limited, he himself didn't know if he could find out where the resentment came from.

"Let's try. If we can find out, maybe we can find some clues."

"I can try, but don't have too much hope." Lu Qianxing had a wry smile on his face. The higher the hope, the greater the disappointment. He was afraid that everyone would have too high expectations of him, and if he failed, it would be unacceptable to everyone.

"Do your best," Old Xu said with a smile, not wanting to put too much pressure on Lu Qianxing.

"Okay." Lu Qianxing nodded, then took out a rusty compass from his pocket. "No matter what you see later, don't make a sound and stay calm." Lu Qianxing instructed Old Xu and the others, then held the compass with one hand, placed the index finger of the other hand in his mouth, bit it lightly, and a drop of blood oozed out. Then, Lu Qianxing dripped the blood from his fingertip onto the compass.

Lu Qianxing muttered an incantation, and then the pointer of the compass began to spin rapidly. While the compass was spinning rapidly, Lu Qianxing took out another talisman from his pocket with his right hand, flicked his hand casually, and the talisman ignited. Rolling black smoke converged above the compass.

When the talisman burned out, a thick layer of black smoke filled the compass. "Break!" Lu Qianxing held the compass in his left hand and shouted loudly. Then, he extended his left hand and threw the compass into the center of the swirling black smoke.

The moment the compass passed through the black smoke, the black smoke dissipated, and then the smell of smoke filled the entire morgue.

Everyone present, including Lu Qianxing, inhaled some of the smoky smell. The moment they inhaled the smoky smell, everyone felt a little dizzy, and then, before their eyes, a little girl seemed to appear indistinctly.

The little girl was wearing a black dress and holding a doll in her arms. At this moment, she seemed to be smiling at everyone.

Seeing this scene, everyone's faces were filled with fear, but remembering Lu Qianxing's instructions, everyone suppressed their fear and gritted their teeth tightly.

"Hehe..." The figure of the little girl became clearer and clearer before everyone's eyes. With a hair-raising laugh, everyone saw that the little girl holding the doll suddenly stretched out a hand and slowly waved at them.

With a tender face and pale complexion, everyone felt an unprecedented and terrifying resentment from the little girl before them.

"Do you want to play with me?" The little girl tilted her head, her big, watery eyes fixed on everyone. Her originally cute appearance now made everyone involuntarily shiver.

"Who are you?" Lu Qianxing gritted his teeth and spoke, cold sweat dripping from his forehead.

"If you play with me, I'll tell you." The little girl still had a playful and cute appearance, but in Lu Qianxing and the others' eyes, that playful and cute appearance hid a terrifying and chilling aura.

Lu Qianxing ignored the little girl's words, just gritted his teeth and said coldly, "Who are you!"

Seeing that Lu Qianxing ignored her, the little girl's face suddenly sank. "None of you want to play with me? Since you don't want to play with me, then I..." Before the little girl could finish her words, her face became ferocious.

The moment Lu Qianxing saw the little girl's ferocious face, he quickly shouted, "Bite your hand!"

As soon as Lu Qianxing finished speaking, he raised his right hand to his mouth and bit his palm fiercely.

Seeing this, Old Xu and the others had no time to hesitate. Like Lu Qianxing, they raised their right hands to their mouths and bit down fiercely.

As the sharp pain appeared, the cute yet terrifying little girl before them disappeared, leaving only the empty morgue.

(End of this chapter)

title: Chapter 113: Do your best
content:
Chapter 113: Do Your Best

When everything subsided, the palms of Lu Qianxing and his group were left with a row of teeth marks, oozing a little blood.

"Qianxing, are you okay?" Seeing Lu Qianxing stumble backward a few steps, Old Xu quickly stepped forward to support him.

At this moment, Lu Qianxing's face was pale, his lips were purple, and his whole person looked very weak.

"I'm fine, just a little too exhausted. How about everyone else? Is everyone okay?" Lu Qianxing said, looking at the others.

"My hands just hurt a little, but other than that, nothing else." Chen Hui only felt a dull ache in his hands.

"Yes, we're the same. Our hands just hurt a little. We're fine," Zhao Zhen and Ning Hua also nodded.

"That's good." Seeing that everyone was fine, Lu Qianxing breathed a sigh of relief. "Uncle Xu, let's go out first to avoid any further trouble."

No one had any objections to Lu Qianxing's suggestion. Afterward, with the support of Old Xu and Chen Hui, the group left the morgue.

"Qianxing, should we lock this door?" Zhao Zhen asked Lu Qianxing, holding the lock after closing the morgue's iron door.

"Lock it," Lu Qianxing said weakly.

"I say, Qianxing, are you really okay? You don't look too good." Chen Hui felt that Lu Qianxing's hands were cold and was a little worried.

"I'm really fine, just a bit weak," Lu Qianxing forced a smile.

"This time it's my fault. Qianxing, don't push yourself too hard in the future. Just do your best." Old Xu felt a trace of guilt. If it weren't for his suggestion to have Lu Qianxing investigate the source of the resentment, Lu Qianxing wouldn't have ended up like this.

"Uncle Xu, you were just trying to investigate the case, so you can't blame yourself. Moreover, this method was not dangerous at all. It's just that the resentment was too great, and my cultivation was insufficient, which is why..." Lu Qianxing sighed at the end.

"Qianxing, who exactly was that little girl just now? Why was she exactly the same as the girl in the bronze coffin?" Seeing that everyone was fine, Ning Hua spoke up, asking about the little girl from earlier.

Lu Qianxing actually had the same question. "I'm not very sure either."

"Qianxing, did the resentment originate from that little girl?" Old Xu, who was supporting Lu Qianxing, also asked.

"You could say yes, or you could say no."

"What do you mean?" Hearing Lu Qianxing's answer, confusion flickered across everyone's faces.

"The resentment did originate from the little girl we saw, but I believe that to gather such terrifying resentment, she must have died with terrible grievances in life. However, based on the clues and speculations we have so far, if the little girl here is the same person as the girl in the bronze coffin, then her resentment shouldn't be this heavy." According to the previous speculation by Lu Qianxing and others, the girl in the bronze coffin and the girl who died in an accident were the same person, and the girl who died in an accident should not have such terrifying resentment.

After hearing Lu Qianxing's words, everyone else also frowned and pondered.

"Qianxing, I remember you mentioned something about 'borrowing a corpse to return a soul' before. Could the heavy resentment on that little girl be related to 'borrowing a corpse to return a soul'?" Chen Hui recalled what Lu Qianxing had said about 'borrowing a corpse to return a soul' before.

"'Borrowing a corpse to return a soul' is just about the soul of a deceased person using the body of someone who just died to be resurrected. It has nothing to do with resentment," Lu Qianxing explained to Chen Hui, negating Chen Hui's idea.

"Qianxing, besides the resentment, did you find anything else?" Old Xu and the others couldn't investigate everything related to the morgue, so they could only leave the investigation to Lu Qianxing.

To Old Xu's question, Lu Qianxing shook his head. "No."

"If there are no clues, we can only move on to the next location," Zhao Zhen said, looking at Old Xu.

Old Xu nodded first, then asked Lu Qianxing and Chen Hui, "Qianxing, Chen Hui, I haven't had a chance to ask yet, but have you found any clues on your end?" Since they hadn't found any clues, Old Xu placed his hopes on Lu Qianxing and Chen Hui.

"We investigated two crime scenes where the 'mysterious woman burning joss paper' was suspected to have appeared. At both crime scenes, we found some commonalities. Firstly, at the crime scenes, we found 'joss paper that was only half-burned' and a mysterious 'figure in black robes.' In addition, in the case in Yingze District, we suspect there were two victims, one was 'Shi Tao,' whose body was found, and the other was 'Li Nan,' who went missing. We also encountered a 'ghost' at the scene of the drunken assault case. According to the 'ghost,' the 'mysterious woman burning joss paper' is an ordinary person, but she carries a deep 'resentment.'" Chen Hui described their findings in detail to Old Xu and the other two.

"It seems you've made quite a bit of progress," Old Xu sighed after listening to Chen Hui's narration.

"What do you mean by 'figure in black robes' and 'ghost'?" Zhao Zhen was more sensitive to the matters concerning the 'figure in black robes' and the 'ghost' in Chen Hui's description.

"Regarding this 'figure in black robes,' I do have some impression. Qianxing also mentioned before that the lonely soul you asked about told you that a 'man in black' had appeared at the crime scene," Old Xu said, looking at Lu Qianxing.

"He appeared at two crime scenes. Could this man in black be the murderer?" Ning Hua also speculated.

"It's not impossible, but we haven't figured out the identities of the 'figure in black robes' and the 'mysterious woman burning joss paper.' Without any concrete evidence, we can't make a judgment yet." Chen Hui had also considered Ning Hua's speculation, but without any concrete evidence, such speculation was merely a deduction.

"Why do I feel like we're getting further and further away from the truth?" Zhao Zhen sighed. Although many clues had been found so far, there was no definitive clue that could bring them closer to the truth.

"This case is different from previous ones. However, I believe that as long as we continue to investigate, we will find useful clues, and then we can bring the real culprit to justice." Old Xu remained convinced that as long as they kept investigating, the case would eventually be solved.

"That may be true, but how much time do we have left?" Chen Hui shook his head and sighed. Facing the public's questioning, there was not much time left for them to investigate.

"Let's do our best. At least it's not like we found nothing," Old Xu persuaded everyone.

Upon hearing Old Xu's words, no one else said anything, they just nodded.

Afterward, Old Xu and his group left. However, since Lu Qianxing could not resolve the resentment in the morgue, he had to find the hospital director, give him several talismans, and instruct the director to seal off the morgue and not allow anyone to enter under any circumstances.

For this reason, the director found people to erect an iron fence around the morgue and put up a notice, completely sealing off the morgue.

After leaving the hospital, Lu Qianxing and the other person parted ways with Old Xu and his group again. Lu Qianxing and the other person went to the third location where the "mysterious woman burning joss paper" was suspected to have appeared, based on the video circulating online. Old Xu and his group, informed by the director, went to the nearest crematorium to continue investigating the clues about "Li Chao and his son."

(End of Chapter)

title: Chapter 114 Another Dead
content:
Chapter 114: Another Deceased

"Hey, Brother Lin."

"Mm, how is it? Any results from the investigation?"

"I've investigated all the victims from all the cases, and I haven't found anyone whose situation is the same as Li Chao and his son."

"Mm, anything else you've discovered?"

"Brother Lin, do you remember the accident from five years ago?"

"I remember. What about it?"

"Among the five deceased in that accident from five years ago, besides that little girl Zhou Yi, I've identified the identity of another deceased."

Upon hearing Fang Chen's words, Lin Xiao's gaze instantly sharpened. "Who?"

"Li Yang."

"Li Yang!?" Hearing this name, a flicker of surprise crossed Lin Xiao's face. "Where did you find that out?"

"I found Li Yang's former lover. From Li Yang's former lover, I learned something. His former lover told me that Li Yang had lied to his wife, saying he was going on a business trip, but in reality, Li Yang was meeting her in secret. While Li Yang was with his former lover, one day, Li Yang received a call from a stranger. After finishing the call, Li Yang left alone. From then on, Li Yang's former lover could no longer contact him. For this reason, Li Yang's former lover even sneaked near Li Yang's home to find him, but she said that when she quietly approached Li Yang, he seemed not to recognize her. About a week later, the news reported that Li Chao and his son had an accident."

After listening to Fang Chen's narration, Lin Xiao fell into thought. After a long pause, he slowly spoke, "How did you determine that Li Yang was connected to the accident from five years ago?"

"The time Li Yang left his former lover's place perfectly matches the time of the accident five years ago."

"Anything else?" Lin Xiao asked Fang Chen calmly. If it were just a guess, Lin Xiao didn't think Fang Chen would have told him so definitively that one of the deceased in the accident five years ago was Li Yang.

"Li Yang's former lover heard Li Yang's phone conversation with the stranger. The person on the phone asked Li Yang to go to 'Blackwater Village.' The time and place all match. I think if this is a coincidence, it's too much of a coincidence." Fang Chen didn't believe all of this was just a coincidence.

"What about Li Chao? Have you found any clues about Li Chao?" Lin Xiao didn't continue asking about Li Yang but shifted his focus to Li Chao.

"I found the school Li Chao attended. After the investigation, I discovered that Li Chao was a very unremarkable person. Neither his teachers nor his classmates had a strong impression of him. Moreover, Li Chao had no friends, and no one knows what kind of person Li Chao really was." During this period, Fang Chen's investigation into Li Chao and his son was very thorough.

"Okay, I got it. Continue your investigation and see if you can find anything about Li Chao."

"Okay."

After hanging up Fang Chen's call, Lin Xiao fell into thought, replaying the clues Fang Chen had found in his mind.

As Lin Xiao was contemplating, a police officer in his early forties knocked and entered Lin Xiao's office.

"Captain Lin, we can go."

"Mm, let's go." Seeing the police officer in his early forties, Lin Xiao nodded and got up to leave the office with him.

In order to solve the case, Lin Xiao visited the crime scenes of various cases multiple times every day during this period. Although he hadn't found any key clues, Lin Xiao remained persistent, investigating the crime scenes over and over again.

"Captain Lin, where are we going to investigate today?" the police officer in his early forties asked respectfully. For these past few days, it had been himself accompanying Lin Xiao in the investigation.

"Yunxiang High School." Lin Xiao said calmly.

"Okay."

Due to the successive occurrence of cases, although Lin Xiao had not slacked off on the Yunxiang High School case, he was still overwhelmed during this period.

"By the way, what's your name?" During the investigations of the past few days, Lin Xiao had been so focused on the cases that he hadn't had any leisure time to think about other matters, so he didn't even know the name of the police officer in his early forties beside him.

As he was driving, the police officer in his early forties heard Lin Xiao ask him and a slightly excited smile appeared on his face. "Captain Lin, my name is Shen Hua."

"Shen Hua." Lin Xiao murmured, nodded, and didn't say anything further.

Shen Hua drove, and Lin Xiao sat in the passenger seat, diligently reviewing a stack of documents. After about an hour, they arrived at the crime scene of the Yunxiang High School case, a derelict house.

After getting out of the car, Shen Hua followed Lin Xiao into the house. However, as soon as they entered, Shen Hua frowned. Even though many days had passed, there was still a pungent, foul odor in the house.

"Why is there so much blood everywhere? What happened!" Seeing bloodstains all over the house, Shen Hua's face was filled with surprise.

Lin Xiao ignored Shen Hua and moved around the room, carefully examining it.

"Captain Lin, what exactly happened here!" Seeing the tragic scene in the house, Shen Hua was very curious about what had happened in the first place.

The police had only announced to the public that the bodies of four students were found in a derelict house in the Yunxiang High School case, without disclosing any details about the crime scene.

"Just as you see, when we arrived at the crime scene, the bodies of the four deceased had been torn apart by something unknown." Lin Xiao did not hide the situation in the house from Shen Hua, but at the same time, he did not describe the situation in great detail, only passing over it with a simple sentence.

"Torn apart by something unknown!" Although it was just a simple sentence, a terrifying image played out in Shen Hua's mind: the bodies of four students torn apart, blood splattering and staining the entire house.

"Captain Lin, there are rumors outside that the recent cases were committed by a fierce ghost. Is it true?" Shen Hua thought of the outside rumors and, combined with what he saw, a thought occurred to him.

Hearing Shen Hua's words, Lin Xiao turned, looked at Shen Hua calmly, and then said coldly, "Do you believe in ghosts?"

"Ah." Lin Xiao's question stunned Shen Hua for a moment, but he immediately shook his head, "No, I don't believe in them."

"Then what if I told you that the recent cases were indeed committed by a fierce ghost." Lin Xiao said with a calm, cold expression.

"Ah!" Hearing this, Shen Hua froze in place, his face full of shock.

"Without any evidence, any judgment is useless. If you want to know if it's a fierce ghost, investigate properly." Lin Xiao finished speaking, turned, and continued to investigate the crime scene, ignoring Shen Hua.

Shen Hua stood frozen, looking at the diligently investigating Lin Xiao, sighed, shook his head slightly, and then, like Lin Xiao, began to carefully investigate the crime scene.

(End of this chapter)

title: Chapter 115 Identity
content:
Chapter 115: Identity

On a winter night, heavy snow fell, blanketing the entire city. On the frigid streets, everyone, bundled in thick cotton-padded jackets, hurried towards "home" as quickly as possible.

"It's so cold! The weather this year is truly exaggeratedly cold!"

"Who says it isn't? I heard the lowest temperature today is expected to break minus 40 degrees Celsius."

"Minus 40 degrees? Seriously!"

"Look! My phone is even frozen and won't turn on!"

"No way! Really! It's minus 38 degrees now! A new record."

Several employees who had just finished work, though layered in multiple cotton coats, still felt a bone-chilling cold.

"I can't take it anymore! I'm going to take a taxi back. Are you guys coming? If so, let's go together."

"Let's go, let's go! Together, together. In this terrible weather, if we stay any longer, I think we'll turn into ice sculptures." Several employees hailed a taxi by the roadside and all piled into the car.

With temperatures at minus 38 degrees Celsius and heavy snow falling, no one was willing to stay outdoors in such cold weather. Everyone wanted to return home immediately, burrow under their blankets, and have a good sleep.

As the night deepened, the usually bustling streets became deserted. Under the faint light at a bus stop, a girl stood, wearing a thick down jacket.

"Little girl, are you going somewhere? It's so late, the bus is long gone." A passing taxi stopped at the bus stop. The driver rolled down the window and called out to the girl standing there.

"Oh, I'm not going anywhere! I'm waiting for someone. The person picking me up will be here soon," the girl replied with a smile.

"Alright then, little girl. It's late at night, and there isn't even a shadow of a person around. Be careful," the driver said with concern. After speaking, he rolled up the window and drove away.

"Thank you." The girl offered a grateful smile. However, after the taxi had driven away, two streams of tears silently fell from her eyes.

In reality, the girl standing at the bus stop wasn't waiting for anyone. She had been working as a customer service representative at a company, but was fired due to a complaint from a deliberately troublesome customer. After being dismissed, the girl had nowhere to go. Her money was almost depleted, and she couldn't even afford accommodation, forcing her to wander the streets.

In the freezing temperature, despite being dressed in a thick down jacket, the girl couldn't ward off the biting wind. She struggled to walk through the snow. After a short while, she felt her head swimming. A little further on, she collapsed into a snowdrift.

The next day, as the sun rose, the girl felt no trace of cold on her body. In a daze, she opened her eyes and found herself lying in a room. On a table beside her, there was a cup of steaming hot water.

"You're awake." A gruff voice, tinged with a bit of weariness, sounded. The girl was startled for a moment, then turned her head to the side.

There sat a man with a face etched with years of hardship. He was wearing a black tracksuit and was sitting on a stool by her bed, staring at her blankly.

"You! Who are you!" the girl asked, looking at the man with panic and a face full of vigilance.

"You collapsed in the snow last night and still have a fever. There's medicine on the table. Take it when you get up. There are dishes I just heated up in the kitchen. If you're hungry, go eat," the man said in a deep voice. After speaking, he stood up and left the girl's room.

"I..." The girl tried to say something, but the man had already left. With the sound of a heavy door closing, the girl managed to get out of bed. Once she confirmed she hadn't been harmed in any way, she let out a sigh of relief.

The girl first drank the medicine on the table, then walked out of the room. She immediately saw the dishes on the kitchen table, as the man had said they were already heated.

Having not eaten a proper meal for many days, the girl bit her lip as she looked at the dishes on the table. Finally, she sat down at the table and cleared her plate. After eating, she tidied up the dishes and then curiously explored the house she was in.

The house wasn't large. It had two bedrooms. One was the bedroom she had slept in last night, and the other seemed to be the man's. The man's bedroom was locked, and the girl couldn't open it.

Besides that, there was a kitchen and a small living room. The entire house was meticulously organized, not a speck of mess.

On the coffee table in the living room, the girl found a family photo. In the picture, she saw the man from before, along with a young woman and a little girl. The girl guessed that the other two must be the man's wife and child.

For the rest of the day, the man didn't return. It wasn't until late at night that he came back.

"You're back." When the man returned, the girl greeted him with a smile.

"Mm, are you okay now?" the man asked in a deep voice, his face expressionless.

"I'm fine. Um, thank you for yesterday," the girl said, showing a grateful smile.

"Mm, it's nothing." The man's face remained expressionless. After a brief exchange with the girl, he returned to his bedroom.

The next morning, the girl bid farewell to the man and left alone.

To investigate the "mysterious woman burning paper money," Ye Bin and Zhang Lan sat in front of their computers, searching for clues online. However, neither of them found any useful information.

"Binzi, do you think this 'mysterious woman burning paper money' is a person or a ghost? We've been searching for so long and haven't found a single clue. It's too unscientific," Zhang Lan rubbed his neck, feeling like it was about to break from sitting at the computer for so long.

Hearing Zhang Lan's words, Ye Bin recalled the scene of his encounter with the mysterious girl.

"She's probably a person," Ye Bin murmured. Although he had the same question in his heart, deep down, he felt that the "mysterious woman burning paper money" was a normal person.

"If she's a person, there's no reason we can't find her," Zhang Lan frowned, looking at the discussions from netizens on the computer screen. There was a significant debate about whether the "mysterious woman burning paper money" was human or a ghost.

Just as they were feeling troubled, Ye Bin's phone suddenly rang.

"Ye He." Ye Bin picked up his phone and was surprised to see it was Ye He calling. "Hello, Ye He, what's wrong?"

"Brother, I've found some clues."

"Clues? What clues? I thought I told you not to help me investigate anymore. Why are you still investigating on your own?" Ye Bin asked coldly, questioning Ye He. To prevent Ye He from getting involved in the "Route 18" bus case, Ye Bin had instructed Ye He to avoid investigating anything dangerous when he first asked for his help. Ye Bin was afraid that Ye He's independent investigation would lead him to be associated with the "Route 18" bus case.

"Brother, I know you're worried. I haven't investigated the 'Blackwater Village' or the 'Route 18' bus matter you mentioned. I just investigated the 'mysterious woman burning paper money' from the internet a while ago," Ye He also understood Ye Bin's good intentions, so he had avoided all dangerous matters during his investigation.

Hearing Ye He's answer, Ye Bin's worry subsided a little. "From now on, for any investigation, you are not allowed to conduct it yourself without my consent."

"Okay." Ye He readily agreed to Ye Bin's request and then began to explain the clues he had found. "Brother, I've processed the video clip from the internet recently. I've restored the video and identified the woman's appearance. Moreover, I've also found her identity."

(End of Chapter)

title: Chapter 116 Ding Xiaoqian
content:
Chapter 116: Ding Xiaoqian

"Ding Xiaoqian." Ye Bin found the name Ye He mentioned very familiar, as if he had heard it somewhere before.

"I found out she's an orphan. Her mother died of heart disease when she was young, and her father is missing and unreachable. Since there were no other relatives, she was sent to an orphanage." As Ye He spoke, he sent the information he had gathered to Ye Bin's computer.

"Orphanage." Ye Bin murmured. Upon learning that Ding Xiaoqian had lived in an orphanage since childhood, a scene of his encounter with a mysterious girl vaguely flashed in his mind.

"Don't you remember me? I'm Yaya."

"Yaya! It's her!" Finally, combined with Ye He's findings, Ye Bin's mind recalled that in his memory, there was indeed a little girl named "Yaya." This little girl was also an orphan from the orphanage. When he was young, he had visited the orphanage with his mother and met this little girl named "Yaya."

"Brother, you know her?" Ye He was also a little surprised to hear Ye Bin speak.

"Ye He, can you find out where Ding Xiaoqian is now?" Ye Bin didn't answer Ye He's question and pressed on.

"I've already checked, but I only found that Ding Xiaoqian seemed to have left X City five years ago."

"Where did she go?"

"J City. However, I investigated J City afterwards and couldn't find any clues related to Ding Xiaoqian. After Ding Xiaoqian left X City five years ago, she disappeared, and no clues related to her could be found." Ye He's investigation was very thorough; he had thought of everything Ye Bin could think of.

"Well, if there are any more questions, I will contact you. From now on, you must remember not to investigate any cases privately, understand?" Ye Bin solemnly instructed before hanging up.

"Okay, I understand, brother. If anything comes up, you contact me. Brother, be careful." Ye Bin worried about Ye He's safety, and conversely, Ye He was always worried about Ye Bin's safety.

"Binzi, what do we do now? Should we ask Detective Lin for help to find this Ding Xiaoqian?" Zhang Lan had also overheard Ye Bin's conversation with Ye He. Since Ye He couldn't find any clues about Ding Xiaoqian, Zhang Lan thought perhaps Lin Xiao might have a way to find her.

Ye Bin shook his head slightly at Zhang Lan's words. "Brother Lan, I want to investigate it myself first."

"Binzi, isn't this Ding Xiaoqian your old flame?" Zhang Lan said jokingly. In reality, he felt that when Ye Bin learned of the other party's true identity, he seemed to have some unspeakable feelings for Ding Xiaoqian.

"Brother Lan, you're teasing me again. You all call me a straight man all day; who would be my lover?" Ye Bin replied with an embarrassed smile.

"You can't say for sure about this kid, I can't see through you." Zhang Lan chuckled, then patted Ye Bin's shoulder. His expression suddenly turned serious. "Binzi, I can see from your face that this girl named Ding Xiaoqian seems to be very important to you. However, I still have to give you a reminder: don't let too many personal emotions interfere with solving the case, otherwise, you won't be able to find the truth of the case."

Ye Bin nodded solemnly at Zhang Lan's advice. "Don't worry, Brother Lan, I know what I'm doing."

Afterward, to investigate Ding Xiaoqian, Ye Bin and Zhang Lan disguised themselves and ventured to the orphanage where Ding Xiaoqian used to live.

"It seems this girl named Ding Xiaoqian is indeed unusual for you," Zhang Lan said jokingly as he drove towards the orphanage.

Ye Bin could only offer an embarrassed smile to Zhang Lan's joke. In reality, as Zhang Lan had said, Ding Xiaoqian was indeed a different existence in Ye Bin's heart.

After driving for about forty minutes, they reached the orphanage. Upon arrival, Ye Bin contacted a teacher from the orphanage. This teacher was a classmate of his mother and was very familiar with him, and Ye Bin trusted her greatly.

"Aunt Jiang, long time no see." The moment Ye Bin saw Jiang Lan, he felt a sense of closeness towards her.

"You rascal, you've gotten yourself into big trouble. You never give your mother a moment's peace!" Jiang Lan showed a very warm smile when she saw Ye Bin.

Ye Bin scratched his head and gave an embarrassed smile.

"Let's go, we'll talk in my office." Jiang Lan led Ye Bin and Zhang Lan into her office. Jiang Lan was no longer just a teacher at the orphanage; she had become the vice-dean.

"Aunt Jiang, this is my colleague, Zhang Lan." After entering Jiang Lan's office, Ye Bin introduced Zhang Lan to her.

Jiang Lan looked Zhang Lan up and down, then nodded with a smile. "Hello, I'm Jiang Lan, Auntie to this little fellow Ye Bin."

"Hello, I'm Zhang Lan." Zhang Lan smiled and quickly extended his hand to shake Jiang Lan's.

"I trust this kid Xiao Bin, he wouldn't do anything bad. Speaking of which, you're not a bad person, are you?" Jiang Lan's direct question made Ye Bin and Zhang Lan freeze for a moment, and an awkward expression flashed across their faces.

"Aunt Jiang, oh, don't worry. Brother Lan isn't a bad person. I'm the one who dragged Brother Lan into this mess this time." Ye Bin said with an embarrassed laugh, explaining to Jiang Lan.

"Really?" Jiang Lan looked Zhang Lan up and down with suspicion.

Zhang Lan wore a helpless smile, letting Jiang Lan examine him without saying a word.

"Aunt Jiang, don't worry!"

"Alas, this world is so chaotic. Tell me, what exactly happened to you, boy? Why are you wanted by the whole city? They say you're the murderer in these recent cases?" Finally, Jiang Lan decided to trust Zhang Lan for now and then looked at Ye Bin beside her.

Hearing Jiang Lan's question, Ye Bin sighed, "It's a long story."

"If it's a long story, then don't tell it. As long as I know you're alright, that's good enough. Tell me, why did you come to me this time? Did something happen?" Jiang Lan trusted Ye Bin very much. Even if everyone else suspected Ye Bin, she never had any doubts, after all, she had watched Ye Bin grow up.

"I came this time to inquire about someone from you, Aunt Jiang."

"Inquire about someone? Who are you inquiring about?"

"Aunt Jiang, do you know if there was someone named 'Ding Xiaoqian' in the orphanage?" Ye Bin got straight to the point and asked directly.

"Ding Xiaoqian." Jiang Lan murmured, furrowing her brow in thought. After a moment, Jiang Lan seemed to recall something. "Oh, you mean that very pretty young girl?" Jiang Lan's memory of Ding Xiaoqian was that she was very beautiful.

Ye Bin nodded. "Yes, her."

"Why are you asking about that girl? What's up? Did you take a liking to her?" Jiang Lan said with a mischievous smile.

Seeing Jiang Lan's expression, Ye Bin gave a helpless smile. "Aunt Jiang, stop teasing me. This Ding Xiaoqian might be related to a case I'm currently investigating, so I want to find her."

"Oh, so that's how it is. However, Ding Xiaoqian left the orphanage many years ago. At that time, I remember she came back to the orphanage, saying where she was going..." Jiang Lan tried to recall, but couldn't remember what Ding Xiaoqian had said. "Alas, I can't remember. You should ask the girls who were close to Ding Xiaoqian back then. She's also a teacher at the orphanage now."

(End of Chapter)

title: Chapter 117 Lover
content:
Chapter 117: The One She Loves

With Jiang Lan's help, Ye Bin and Zhang Lan successfully found Ding Xiaoqian's best friend, Liang Yue.

"Why are you looking for Qianqian?" Although introduced by Jiang Lan, Liang Yue was very wary of Ye Bin and the other person, as Ye Bin and the other were currently wanted "murderers" by the police.

"Xiao Yue, don't worry. Jiang Yi has watched this child grow up since she was little. If you don't believe him, you can believe Jiang Yi." Seeing Liang Yue's wary expression, Jiang Lan quickly spoke to ease the tension.

"Jiang Yi, it's not that I don't believe you. These two are wanted 'murderers' by the police. They say they have several murder cases on their hands." Even with Jiang Lan's persuasion, Liang Yue still didn't believe Ye Bin and Zhang Lan.

Hearing Liang Yue's words, Jiang Lan also gave an embarrassed smile. "Xiao Yue, Jiang Yi knows your worries, but Jiang Yi can assure you that this child is absolutely fine." Jiang Lan said this, patting her chest to guarantee it to Liang Yue.

Liang Yue had been raised by Jiang Lan since she was little, so she understood Jiang Lan. Now that Jiang Lan was making such a guarantee, Liang Yue understood that Jiang Lan truly trusted Ye Bin.

"Jiang Yi, although I don't know why you trust him so much, I still have doubts about him. However, since you've guaranteed it, I'll assume Jiang Yi is right for now." If not for Jiang Lan's guarantee, Liang Yue would never have believed Ye Bin and the other person.

"Thank you." Ye Bin gave Liang Yue a grateful smile.

"You don't need to thank me. Although I believe Jiang Yi, I can tell you about Qianqian. However, don't expect to find many clues from me, because I haven't been in contact with Qianqian for nearly five years." In fact, after they parted ways five years ago, Liang Yue hadn't contacted Ding Xiaoqian at all.

Hearing this, Ye Bin nodded, then smiled and asked, "It's okay, I just want to ask you where Ding Xiaoqian went five years ago, and why she left X City?"

"If you ask it like that, I'm truly powerless. Five years ago, Qianqian just said she was going to find her 'lover' and left. As for why she left X City, I actually don't even know when she left X City. The last time I saw her five years ago, she just told me she was going to do something, but she didn't say what." Liang Yue said, recalling the last time she saw Ding Xiaoqian.

"'Lover'? Do you know who her lover is?" When Ye Bin heard the words "lover," he felt that this "lover" might be related to the case.

"I don't know who Qianqian's lover is. I only know that person seems very important to Qianqian. Qianqian has a toy that her lover left her. That toy has been with her for a very long time. Once, that toy was lost, and Qianqian searched for it in the heavy rain for a whole day." In fact, Liang Yue didn't know about Ding Xiaoqian's lover from Ding Xiaoqian herself, but it was Liang Yue's own guess. When she was with Ding Xiaoqian, she often saw Ding Xiaoqian spacing out while holding that toy.

"Now that you mention it, I also remember that little girl didn't like any pretty dolls back then, she only held a faded toy and treated it like her 'family.' I remember one time, some mischievous children from the orphanage snatched her toy. For that toy, that very quiet girl actually took a knife from the kitchen and chased after the children who took her toy. That really startled me back then!" Speaking of the toy, Jiang Lan also recalled past events.

"'Toy.'" Ye Bin murmured, curious about what kind of toy could make a quiet girl chase people with a knife.

"Perhaps it was left by her parents," Zhang Lan guessed.

"I once asked Qianqian. She said no. She also said that the toy was left to her by her only 'family.'"

"'Only family.'" Ye Bin murmured. He increasingly felt that the person Liang Yue was talking about was greatly related to the case. Ye Bin even guessed that Ding Xiaoqian's disappearance was likely connected to this person in some way.

"Do you know who this family member is?" Zhang Lan's thoughts were basically the same as Ye Bin's.

To Zhang Lan's question, Liang Yue shook her head. "Qianqian doesn't like to talk, and she doesn't like to interact with people. Even when she was with me, she rarely talked about her past." In Liang Yue's eyes, Ding Xiaoqian was a quiet and introverted girl.

"That's true. If I didn't remember she was a very beautiful little girl, I wouldn't have much of an impression of her," Jiang Lan recalled. The memories of Ding Xiaoqian in her mind were very scarce.

"This Ding Xiaoqian is quite mysterious," Zhang Lan sighed.

"Then do you know if she found her lover?" Ye Bin asked Liang Yue while thinking.

Liang Yue shook her head. "I don't know about that. The last time we met five years ago, I did ask her, but she didn't say. At that time, I remember the topic was skipped because of something." Liang Yue knew nothing about Ding Xiaoqian's lover.

"Oh, right. I have a painting there, drawn by Qianqian. I guess that person is her lover." Suddenly, Liang Yue remembered that she had a portrait drawn by Ding Xiaoqian.

"Where is it?"

"In my dorm. Please wait a moment, I'll go get it."

About twenty minutes later, Liang Yue returned with a piece of 4K paper.

"This is Qianqian's painting," Liang Yue said, handing the painting to Ye Bin.

Ye Bin took the painting, and the first glance gave him a very familiar feeling.

The painting depicted a little boy holding a toy in his hand. The toy looked very much like Ultraman from television.

"This is Ultraman Tiga, isn't it?" Zhang Lan pointed to the toy in the little boy's hand in the painting and said.

"Yes, it should be." Ye Bin nodded. Although the Ultraman in the painting wasn't accurate, the general outline could vaguely distinguish it as from a very popular TV series from a long time ago, "Ultraman Tiga."

"Who is this little boy? To make a little girl remember him so much." Looking at the little boy in the painting, Zhang Lan was very puzzled. What kind of emotion could make a little girl remember someone for so many years?

"Yes, I also don't quite understand Qianqian." Even as a girl, Liang Yue couldn't understand why that unknown little boy could make Ding Xiaoqian remember him for so long.

Just as Ye Bin, Zhang Lan, and Liang Yue were wondering who Ding Xiaoqian's lover was, Jiang Lan, who was watching the painting, looked at it for a long time and suddenly said, "Xiao Bin, doesn't this boy look like you?"

"Ah!" Hearing Jiang Lan's words, Ye Bin was stunned, and then he thought Jiang Lan was joking. "Jiang Yi, you're teasing me again."

"No, no, no! Look at this outfit, I remember it very clearly. I bought it for you back then. Look! On these two sleeves, one is written 'Wen' and the other is written 'Wu.' Jiang Yi sewed them on specifically." Jiang Lan said, pointing to the two characters on the shoulders of the little boy in the painting, one reading "Wen" and the other reading "Wu."

"Indeed, the words 'Wen' and 'Wu.'" Zhang Lan also saw that the shoulders of the little boy in the painting indeed had two words written on them. "Holy cow, Binzi, if this is really you, then you!" Zhang Lan said, looking at Ye Bin with a shocked expression.

"Then that's a real coincidence." Ye Bin frowned, his heart filled with shock.

(End of this chapter)

title: Chapter 118 Ignore
content:
Chapter 118: Overlooked

After leaving the hospital and parting ways with Chen Hui, Old Xu and his group headed to the nearest crematorium to inquire about clues regarding Li Chao and his son.

"This must be the crematorium. It looks a bit creepy," Old Xu murmured as the three of them left the hospital and drove to the crematorium. Due to the time, it was already around 8 PM. The large iron gate of the crematorium was open, but no one was visible inside.

"This place feels even more oppressive than the morgue," Ning Hua said, frowning, feeling a sense of heaviness in his heart.

"Let's go ask at the gatehouse first. If we can't get any information, we'll come back tomorrow morning," Old Xu suggested, also finding the atmosphere of the crematorium unnerving.

Ning Hua and Zhao Zhen nodded, agreeing with Old Xu's proposal.

The three of them then approached the guardhouse next to the crematorium's iron gate and knocked on the door.

A scruffy old man in his sixties, yawning, opened the door.

"Who is it this late at night? What do you need?" the old man asked, stretching lazily, clearly having just woken up.

"Hello, we are police officers. We need to investigate something here," Old Xu said, extending a hand to the old man.

"Police? What are you investigating in the middle of the night? All I have in here are dead people. What can you possibly find?" The old man's attitude was poor, and he looked impatient while talking to the three of them.

"We apologize, but the case is urgent, and we need to investigate immediately," Old Xu continued to communicate calmly.

"It's this late. No matter how urgent your case is, it's useless. Everyone's gone home after work. Even if you want to investigate, you need people, don't you? Are you expecting the dead to help you investigate?" The old man's words were sharp and unkind.

"What kind of way is that to talk! Can't you speak properly!" Zhao Zhen felt irritated by the other man's terrible attitude.

The old man gave Zhao Zhen a dismissive glance. "I speak to humans like a human, and to ghosts like a ghost. What I say depends on who you are."

"You!" Hearing the old man's words, Zhao Zhen gritted his teeth and stepped forward. Old Xu quickly stepped in to stop him. "Old Zhao, calm down. Let's focus on the task at hand."

Zhao Zhen gritted his teeth, snorted at the old man, and turned away.

"Brother, we have something very important to do. Could you please find a way to let us in to take a look?" Old Xu said, pulling out a hundred-yuan bill from his pocket and placing it in the old man's hand.

The old man quickly pocketed the bill, then tilted his head back. "Fine, fine. I'm a bit sleepy myself. I'll go back to sleep. But when I wake up, I don't want to see anyone." The old man stretched, and a set of keys clipped to his waist fell to the ground. He didn't pick them up, however, and instead turned and went back into his room.

Ning Hua, with quick reflexes, picked up the keys.

"We don't have much time, let's go," Old Xu said, signaling for the two of them to enter the crematorium after Ning Hua had picked up the keys.

"Damn it! That old guy is really something else!" Zhao Zhen grumbled all the way, feeling very indignant.

Old Xu didn't say anything about Zhao Zhen's attitude until they reached the crematorium. Old Xu then told Zhao Zhen to stop cursing.

"Ning Hua, find out where the archive room is and see if any of these keys open it."

"Found it," Ning Hua replied, picking out one of the keys.

"Alright, let's go to the archive room and see if we can find any clues."

The archive room was in a building behind the crematorium. Old Xu and the other two first opened the main door of the building, then split into three groups to search the three floors for the archive room. Before long, Zhao Zhen, who was responsible for the third floor, found the archive room.

"Old Xu, Ning Hua, over here!" Zhao Zhen shouted from the staircase, his voice instantly reaching the other two due to the extreme quietness of the surroundings.

Old Xu and Ning Hua ran up to the third floor.

"Ning Hua, try opening it. See if it works."

"Okay," Ning Hua nodded, took out the key to the archive room, and opened the door. "Yes, this is it."

Upon opening the door, they first saw a computer at the entrance of the archive room. Inside, there were four or five rows of shelves filled with dense files.

"I'll see if the computer works." Ning Hua sat down at the computer desk and turned it on. However, when the computer booted up, it displayed a prompt for a password.

"It needs a password? Let's try 123456," Zhao Zhen said, immediately thinking of a very simple password when he saw the password input screen.

"A password that simple is unlikely," Old Xu thought, feeling the password was too simple and definitely wrong.

"It's definitely not possible!" Ning Hua chuckled awkwardly after entering 123456, and the computer screen displayed a message indicating an incorrect password.

Seeing this, Zhao Zhen frowned slightly. "Try 654321, or maybe 123123."

"It's not that simple." Just as Old Xu rolled his eyes at Zhao Zhen, the password box on the computer screen suddenly disappeared, and the system's main interface appeared.

"It actually worked!" Old Xu was stunned to see the computer system's main interface.

"See, I knew it," Zhao Zhen said proudly, smiling.

"The password was eight zeros." Ning Hua chuckled awkwardly again.

"..." Old Xu and Zhao Zhen's faces both sank upon hearing this.

After opening the computer's main interface, Ning Hua skillfully began operating the computer, searching through all of the crematorium's archives.

"There are three people named Li Chao and two named Li Yang, but their death dates are different from those of Li Chao and his son. It seems there are no records for Li Chao and his son here." Although they found the names Li Chao and Li Yang, based on their death dates, they could determine that neither Li Chao nor Li Yang were the people they were looking for.

"Could it be that Li Chao and his son were not cremated at this crematorium?" Zhao Zhen reasoned, as City X had three crematoriums, so the reason they couldn't find Li Chao and his son's records might be that they weren't cremated at this particular facility.

"The other two crematoriums are nearly twice as far from the hospital as this one. That doesn't seem right," Ning Hua murmured, feeling confused.

"Since they aren't here, let's leave for now. Tomorrow morning, we'll investigate the other two crematoriums."

Finally, following Old Xu's advice, the three of them left the crematorium. As it was already very late, they didn't head to the next crematorium but rented a room at a hotel not far from it. The next morning, Old Xu and the other two went to investigate the remaining two crematoriums, but to their bewilderment, neither of the other two crematoriums had any records for Li Chao and his son.

"No cremation records at any of the three crematoriums. What does this mean? Could it be that Li Chao and his son's bodies weren't cremated, but buried instead?" Zhao Zhen speculated.

"Or perhaps there was an oversight in our investigation."

Old Xu did not comment on Zhao Zhen and Ning Hua's conjectures, merely staring at the files on the computer screen, lost in thought.

"We've overlooked the most important thing," Old Xu suddenly realized something and turned to look at Zhao Zhen and Ning Hua.

"The most important thing?"

"Li Yang's remains were not cremated. His remains were buried next to the bus stop in 'Heishui Village'." All along, Old Xu had been focused on finding clues that Li Chao was still alive and had overlooked matters concerning Li Yang.

"That's right! We actually forgot the most important thing. Li Yang's remains were not cremated!" Hearing Old Xu's reminder, Ning Hua and Zhao Zhen instantly recalled the remains they had dug up near the bus stop in 'Heishui Village' â€“ those were Li Yang's!

(End of Chapter)

title: Chapter 119 Question
content:
Chapter 119: Problems

â€œThe crematorium did not find any cremation records for Li Chao and his sonâ€™s bodies, while â€˜Blackwater Villageâ€™ found Li Yangâ€™s uncremated remains. Based on these clues, can we conclude that Li Yang is dead, and Li Chao is still unaccounted for?â€ Zhao Zhen analyzed.

Li Chaoâ€™s appearance should not be a problem and could be distinguished,â€ Ning Hua raised new doubts, not fully agreeing with Old Xuâ€™s guess.

Could it be that their deaths were not accidental, or could their deaths also be related to the â€˜Route 18â€™ bus?â€ After hearing Old Xuâ€™s guess, Zhao Zhen also had his own speculation.

â€œI thought about that too, but I investigated afterward, and there was no â€˜Route 18â€™ bus stop sign near the scene of Li Chao and his sonâ€™s accident. However, if Li Yangâ€™s death occurred at the â€˜Route 18â€™ bus stop sign not far from â€˜Blackwater Village,â€™ that would be another matter.â€

â€œIndeed, the biggest problem now is why Li Yangâ€™s remains were found at â€˜Blackwater Village.â€™â€ Zhao Zhen frowned, lost in thought, but he couldnâ€™t figure out the reason.

â€œI remember the remains were only half of a body.â€

â€œTo be precise, it was half of a torso and a head,â€ Old Xu added to Ning Huaâ€™s statement.

â€œThen the problem arises again: why only half a torso and a head? Where is the other half of the torso?â€ The questions kept coming, making Zhao Zhen feel like his head was about to split open.

â€œRegardless, the most important thing now is to continue looking for clues. If we can find more clues, perhaps we can make other discoveries.â€ Based on what they had found so far, Old Xu and his team were unable to clarify the various issues they were facing.

â€œLooking for clues, easy to say. Weâ€™re like headless flies, just crashing around, not even knowing where the exit is,â€ Zhao Zhen sighed, a look of helplessness on his face.

Not only Zhao Zhen, but even Old Xu at this moment had lost his direction. He wanted to find clues, but faced with a series of questions, he didnâ€™t know where to start.

Meanwhile, Chen Hui and Lu Qianxing, who were investigating the â€œmysterious woman burning joss paper,â€ also found no clues after investigating several locations where the â€œmysterious woman burning joss paperâ€ was suspected to have appeared.

â€œQianxing, did you find anything?â€ Chen Hui, having found nothing after investigating the places suspected to have appeared in the video circulating online, placed his hope on Lu Qianxing.

Lu Qianxing spread his hands and shook his head helplessly.

â€œDid you find any ghosts? If you ask around, maybe youâ€™ll find something.â€

To Chen Huiâ€™s suggestion, Lu Qianxing gave an awkward smile. â€œThere are no lonely souls around here.â€

In the past few days of investigation, Chen Hui and Lu Qianxing had investigated dozens of locations where the â€œmysterious woman burning joss paperâ€ was suspected to have appeared, but the results were all fruitless.

Lu Qianxing said nothing, a wry smile appearing on his face.

â€œQianxing, you say, if â€˜ghosts and spiritsâ€™ really exist in this world, then doesnâ€™t the murderer, after killing so many people, fear retribution? When he goes to hell, wonâ€™t he be cast into the â€˜eighteenth level of hellâ€™?â€ Chen Hui squatted on a step by the roadside and suddenly spoke, looking at Lu Qianxing beside him.

â€œAh.â€ Hearing Chen Huiâ€™s words, Lu Qianxing was taken aback and was momentarily speechless, not knowing how to answer Chen Huiâ€™s question.

After a long pause, Lu Qianxing slowly said, â€œIâ€™m not very sure, but karma cycles, I think there will be retribution.â€

â€œKarma cycles, you say.â€ Chen Hui murmured, then a cold smile appeared on his face. â€œIf itâ€™s karma cycles, then perhaps those people killed by the murderer also had a cause?â€ Chen Hui said, turning to look at Lu Qianxing beside him.

â€œThisâ€¦â€ Being asked this by Chen Hui, Lu Qianxing was instantly stunned. He wanted to retort to Chen Huiâ€™s words, but after thinking about it, he didnâ€™t know how to refute.

â€œQianxing, actually, Iâ€™ve always had a question: arenâ€™t you afraid of ghosts?â€

â€œGhosts?â€

â€œYes, last time I saw you interacting with that â€˜ghost,â€™ you were very calm, so I was wondering why you arenâ€™t afraid of ghosts?â€ Chen Hui looked at Lu Qianxing with confusion.

â€œActually, ghosts are just like people. Itâ€™s just that ghosts are a form of people after they become incomplete.â€ In Lu Qianxingâ€™s mind, there was no difference between ghosts and people.
